Recipe.Description: Bunches of asparagus, cooked and wrapped in Prosciutto.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Set a pot of water to boil.
Remove woody parts from asparagus (hold one end of each spear in each hand, bend it until it breaks, discard the bottom part).
Assemble asparagus in bunches, wrap the bottom 1/3-1/2 with a slice of prosciutto.

Method.Step: Asparagus is best cooked by standing them upright in boiling water so the the lower half is immersed in water and the upper half gets steamed. You can buy special asparagus pots, or you can do like I do and save old coffee cans, cut out tops and bottoms, stand them up in the pan with the asparagus inside. Cook them this way for about 5 minutes or until tender.
Garnish by brushing with melted butter and adding a slice of lemon.
